intro: Scabiosa virens, commonly known as green scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like foliage and clusters of small, sky-blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and is valued for its ornamental appeal and role in supporting pollinators. Scabiosa virens is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
